main.name: Alex Serret
main.description: and my passion is merging these two disciplines into visually appealing and technically impressive projects. I am currently looking to grow in a top-tier engineering environment
main.bio: Since early childhood I've been a gamer. My family likes to joke that I was born with a Nintendo controller in my hand. Unfortunately my work in game development hasn't extended beyond school, but fortunately I have maintained a passion for mixed media. The integration of code and art has long been a primary interest of mine with a high degree of comfort in either world. Currently I am looking to learn much more about front-end development while doing more artistic design projects on the side for friends and family. Outside of work I'm an explorer of new experiences, a horror aficionado, and a craft beer enthusiast among other things. :)
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Skilled in HTML5 with its associated scripting languages and working with integrated copy, graphics, and video. Extensive experience with Adobe Creative Suite and After Effects.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Design Arts
education.description: At Drexel I learned the foundations of web development, user interaction design, graphic design, programming, modeling, animation, visual effects, and game design. My final project was an interactive site for the National Park System of New Jersey, featuring 3D rendered interactive map of park grounds complete with informational pop-ups, educational videos, and 360 views of park and building interiors. I also minored in Fine Arts with a concentration on photography and screen printing.

work.title: Creative Developer
work.description: Within my first year at PointRoll I was promoted from the Asset Intake team to my current role after successfully establishing a process for reviewing and debugging rich media advertising units. As a Creative Developer I am responsible for producing web-based ads (web banners, polite banners, expandable advertisements, takeovers, etc.) using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and formerly Flash. Another primary duty of mine is ensuring client guidelines are incorporated into interface designs and design elements. As part of my job I often participate in brainstorming sessions with extended creative teams to develop design ideas for interactive web pages and modules. My team focuses on automotive clients such as Ford, Chrysler, Nissan and Toyota, who require extremely quick turn-around and low QA issue rates.

work.title: Lead Labeling Graphic Artist
work.description: At Iroko I designed and edited packaging artwork and product labeling for international marketing while adhering to strict pharmaceutical regulations. I was also in charge of providing graphics support for all departments, including preparing visuals for presentations, taking product photographs and creating labeling mock-ups.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
